intro: Physaria gracilis subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and the fruits are distinctive inflated pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
